solution.text:
It is given that the quadrilateral circumscribe the circle
therefore we can also say that from point X,Y,Z,A tangents are drawn to the circle
So for tangent from Z we have ZS=ZP
So for tangent from Y we have YS=YR
So for tangent from X we have XQ=XR
So for tangent from A we have AQ=AP
Adding all the above, ZS+YS+XQ+AQ=ZP+YR+XR+AP
On rearranging, ZS+YS+XQ+AQ=ZP+AP+YR+XR
ZY+AX=AZ+XY
We have perimeter of quadrilateral XYZA= ZY+AX+AZ+XY=_{{36*j}}_
2*(ZY+AX)=_{{36*j}}_
ZY+AX=_{{18*j}}_
\(\Rightarrow ZS+YS+XQ+AQ=_{{18*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow ZP+YS+XR+AP=_{{18*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{j*6}}_+_{{4*j}}_+_{{j*5}}_+AP=_{{18*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow AP=_{{j*18}}_-_{{j*15}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{j*3}}_\)

content.text:
A quadrilateral XYZA circumscribes a circle as shown in the figure
If length of RX=_{{5*j}}_, YS=_{{4*j}}_, ZP=_{{j*6}}_ and perimeter of the quadrilateral is _{{36*j}}_
From the values listed below, choose the correct length of segment AP
